name: Karplusan Giant
text: Tap an untapped snow land you control: Karplusan Giant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of Giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Karplusan Minotaur
text:
Cumulative upkeep—Flip a coin. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever you win a coin flip, Karplusan Minotaur deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Whenever you lose a coin flip, Karplusan Minotaur deals 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice.

name: Karplusan Strider
text: Karplusan Strider can't be the target of blue or black spells.

editions.flavor: The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.
The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.
The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.

name: Karplusan Wolverine
text: Whenever Karplusan Wolverine becomes blocked, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"They're not easily trained. Fortunately, they already know how to kill."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Karplusan Yeti
text: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.

editions.flavor:
"What's that smell?"
—Perena Deepcutter,
Dwarven Armorer

name: Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund
text:
Flying, haste
When Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund enters the battlefield, gain control of all Dragons, then untap all Dragons.
Other Dragon creatures you control have haste.

name: Karstoderm
text:
Karstoderm enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, remove a +1/+1 counter from Karstoderm.

name: Kaseto, Orochi Archmage
text: {G}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn. If that creature is a Snake, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Our revered ancestor Seshiro gave us wisdom greater than poison and fangs."

name: Kashi-Tribe Elite
text:
Legendary Snakes you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
Whenever Kashi-Tribe Elite deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Kashi-Tribe Reaver
text:
Whenever Kashi-Tribe Reaver deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Kashi-Tribe Reaver.

name: Kashi-Tribe Warriors
text: Whenever Kashi-Tribe Warriors deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor: The orochi and the monks had always had an unspoken agreement: live and let live. But when the kami began raging, some warrior youths began questioning that agreement.
Popular indeed is the tale of how Kasimir was once a Holy man who renounced his order to take up the sword. But this tale is no more likely than any other.

name: Katabatic Winds
text:
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Creatures with flying can't attack or block, and their activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.

editions.flavor: Wind will win, whatever we wish.

name: Kataki, War's Wage
text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {1}."

editions.flavor:
"Before the war, we prayed to Kataki to sharpen our swords and harden our armor. Without his blessing our weapons are all but useless against the kami hordes."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Kathari Remnant.

Flying

text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Kavu Aggressor can't block.

name: Kavu Chameleon
text:
Kavu Chameleon can't be countered.
{G}: Kavu Chameleon becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"They weren't part of my plan, but Gaea insisted."

name: Kavu Climber
text: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"There was a crack of branches, a rustle of leaves, then a tremendous roar. Our party had no chance as death descended from above."
—Taseen, elvish bard

"There was a crack of branches, a rustle of leaves, then a tremendous roar. Our party had no chance as death descended from above."
—Taseen, elvish bard
The appearance of the first kavu surprised Multani. As they continued to emerge, he no longer had any doubts about Yavimaya's ability to defend herself.

name: Kavu Glider
text:
{W}: Kavu Glider gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{U}: Kavu Glider gains flying until end of turn.

name: Kavu Howler
text: When Kavu Howler enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Kavu cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Kavu Lair
text: Whenever a creature with power 4 or greater enters the battlefield, its controller draws a card.

editions.flavor: As a dark rain of Phyrexians fell from the sky, fountains of kavu erupted from the ground.

name: Kavu Mauler
text:
Trample
Whenever Kavu Mauler attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each other attacking Kavu.

editions.flavor: To the kavu, all Phyrexians are merely crunchy snacks.

name: Kavu Monarch
text:
Kavu creatures have trample.
Whenever another Kavu enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Kavu Monarch.

editions.flavor: Kavu emerged all across Dominaria, but the first and the strongest came from Yavimaya.

name: Kavu Predator
text:
Trample
Whenever an opponent gains life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Kavu Predator.

editions.flavor: In a withered world, the scent of healthy prey is enough to drive a predator to frenzy.
In a withered world, the scent of healthy prey is enough to drive a predator to frenzy.

name: Kavu Primarch
text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
If Kavu Primarch was kicked, it enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.

name: Kavu Recluse
text: {T}: Target land becomes a Forest until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Few ever see this particular breed of kavu, which hides in forests of its own making.

name: Kavu Runner
text: Kavu Runner has haste as long as no opponent controls a white or blue creature.

name: Kavu Scout
text: Domain — Kavu Scout gets +1/+0 for each basic land type among lands you control.

editions.flavor: The kavu evolved for centuries deep inside Dominaria, and some can draw from its strength.

name: Kavu Titan
text:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
If Kavu Titan was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it and with trample.

text:
0: Exile Kaya, Ghost Assassin or up to one target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of your next upkeep. You lose 2 life.
−1: Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
−2: Each opponent discards a card and you draw a card.

name: Kaysa
text: Green creatures you control get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: Kaysa speaks as the Elder Druid, but the Yavimaya recognizes only one voice: its own.
Kaysa speaks as the elder druid, but Yavimaya recognizes only one voice: its own.

text:
First strike, vigilance
Whenever Kazandu Blademaster or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Kazandu Blademaster.

editions.flavor: "If you hire a sell-sword, you'd better watch your back. Hire me, and I'll watch it for you."

name: Kazandu Refuge
text:
Kazandu Refuge enters the battlefield tapped.

name: Kazuul's Toll Collector
text: {0}: Attach target Equipment you control to Kazuul's Toll Collector. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: Travelers are advised to bring extra swords, preferably shiny ones.

name: Kazuul, Tyrant of the Cliffs
text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls attacks, if you're the defending player, create a 3/3 red Ogre creature token unless that creature's controller pays {3}.

editions.flavor: Warning to those who scale the cliffs without paying tribute: It's a long way down.
Warning to those who scale the cliffs without paying tribute: It's a long way down.

name: Kazuul Warlord
text: Whenever Kazuul Warlord or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on each Ally creature you control.

editions.flavor: On expeditions, minotaurs are worth their weight in gold. Fortunately for their paymasters, most minotaurs don't know how much they weigh.

name: Kederekt Creeper
text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: Bloated with venom, it crawls Grixis looking for victims to ooze onto.

text:
When Kederekt Leviathan enters the battlefield, return all other nonland permanents to their owners' hands.

name: Kederekt Parasite
text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, if you control a red permanent, you may have Kederekt Parasite deal 1 damage to that player.

editions.flavor: When the smell of passing thoughts piques its hunger, its maw becomes primed with acid and a taste for brains.

name: Keeneye Aven
text:
Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: "I have no need of a map. The very continent itself guides my way."

text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: "If it has wings, shoot it. If it doesn't, shoot it anyway."

text:
Flying

name: Keening Stone
text: {5}, {T}: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of cards in that player's graveyard.

editions.flavor: As it spins, dead voices shriek in an ever-increasing cacophony, rending the mind asunder.
As it spins, dead voices shriek in an ever-increasing cacophony, rending the mind asunder.

name: Keen Sense
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: Crovax sensed that Mirri wasn't ready for the curse taking hold of her. Weeping in his heart, he fled.

name: Keeper of Keys
text:
When Keeper of Keys enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you're the monarch, creatures you control can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: For the right price, he'll unlock your path to the throne.

name: Keeper of Kookus
text: {R}: Keeper of Kookus gains protection from red until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Wanted: Thick-skinned goblin for guarding mean ol' Kookus. Must like fires. Must heal quickly.

name: Keeper of Progenitus
text: Whenever a player taps a Mountain, Forest, or Plains for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

editions.flavor: He watches over the valley where Progenitus sleeps, culling signs from its steaming breaths.

name: Keeper of the Beasts
text: {G}, {T}: Choose target opponent who controlled more creatures than you did as you activated this ability. Create a 2/2 green Beast creature token.

name: Keeper of the Dead
text: {B}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had at least two fewer creature cards in his or her graveyard than you did as you activated this ability. Destroy target nonblack creature he or she controls.

name: Keeper of the Flame
text: {R}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had more life than you did as you activated this ability. Keeper of the Flame deals 2 damage to him or her.

name: Keeper of the Lens

text: {W}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had more life than you did as you activated this ability. You gain 3 life.

name: Keeper of the Mind

editions.flavor: This is not a subliminal message.

text: Draw a card for each attacking creature.
